Class Projects

java.lang.Object
PoisedInputChecks
Projects
public class Projects
extends PoisedInputChecks
The Projects class contains all the methods used in the 'PoisedMenu' which pertain to adding, editing, finalising, or viewing various projects for the Poised Management System. It inherits input check methods from the superclass 'PoisedInputChecks' to validate user input.

Author:
Y

  • Constructor Details

    • Projects

      public Projects()

  • Method Details

    • addProject

      public void addProject​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method allows user to create a new project object, which is added to the 'main_project_info' table in the PoisePMS database.

      It prompts users to enter various information related to a new project object, and then connects to the external database to update project information. The 'PoisedMenu' class calls on this method when the user chooses to add a new project to the system.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information

    • editProject

      public void editProject​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method allows users to edit project information, relating to the project due date and total amount paid.

      It displays a sub-menu to the user with two edit choices and executes the action depending on their choice. The edited information is then written under the corresponding column of the 'main_project_info' table in the external PoisePMS database.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information

    • finaliseProject

      public void finaliseProject​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method allows users to finalise a project located in the main_project_info table in the external 'PoisePMS' database.

      The user is prompted to enter a project number to locate the project. If there is an outstanding amount on the project, an invoice is generated and displayed with customer details. Otherwise, the project is just marked as finalised and a completion date is added.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information

    • viewIncomplete

      public void viewIncomplete​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method allows users to view all project objects that are incomplete (i.e. not finalised and no completion date added) in the main_project_info table in the external 'PoisePMS' database.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information

    • viewOverdue

      public void viewOverdue​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.text.ParseException
      This method allows users to view all project objects that are overdue in the main_prject_info table in the external 'PoisePMS' database.

      When called on, the method runs through all deadlines of incomplete projects and compares the deadline date with the current date. If overdue, the project is displayed in an easy-to-read format. If no overdue projects are present, an appropriate error message is displayed to the user.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information
      java.text.ParseException - occurs if a date string is in the wrong format to be parsed

    • findProject

      public void findProject​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method allows users to find project objects from the main_project_info table in the external 'PoisePMS' database by either entering the project name or number.

      Using either name or number, the project is then located from the external database and displayed in an easy-to-read-format.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information

    • printAllFromTable

      public void printAllFromTable​(java.sql.Statement statement) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method displays all information from the main_project_info table in the PoisePMS database when called on.

      Parameters:
      statement - statement object linked to connection to perform SQL commands
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - occurs if there is an error accessing the database information
